issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: The default value of dfs.client.block.write.replace-datanode-on-failure.enable should be true

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Here, "ture" should be "true" if we really do want this feature enabled by default.

{code}
<property>
  <name>dfs.client.block.write.replace-datanode-on-failure.enable</name>
  <value>ture</value>
  ...
</property>
{code}
fields.summary: Typo in hdfs-default.xml causes dfs.client.block.write.replace-datanode-on-failure.enable to be mistakenly disabled

comments.body:
Here's a trivial patch. I decided to change the value to "false" to preserve the current behavior of having the feature disabled by default.

I also took the liberty of fixing another nearby typo.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12514389/HDFS-2944.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1866//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1866//console

This message is automatically generated.
Thanks for the review, Eli. I've just committed this to trunk.

> ... I decided to change the value to "false" to preserve the current behavior of having the feature disabled by default.

The feature was designed to be enabled by default.  Do you see any reason to disable it?

bq. The feature was designed to be enabled by default. Do you see any reason to disable it?

I know of no reason this should be disabled by default, but I'm also not familiar with the development history of the feature. Thus, I figured that should be done as a separate JIRA, given that it's an actual behavior change. Feel free to file the JIRA if you think that change should be made.
Thanks, I created HDFS-2981.
Reopen for committing it to 0.23.
Merged to 0.23.  Thanks Aaron for catching the typo.
